description: TO CONSIDER THE RESOLUTION TO DISMISS BLAIR AND RIVES AS PRINTERS OF THE SENATE FOR THE 27TH CONGRESS.

TO AMEND, IN THE NATURE OF A SUBSTITUTE THE RESOLUTION TO DISMISS BLAIR AND RIVES AS PRINTERS OF THE SENATE FOR THE 27TH CONGRESS; BY SUBSTITUTING THAT SINCE BLAIR AND RIVES WERE ELECTED BY JOINT RESOLUTION OF BOTH HOUSES DURING THE LAST SESSION, IT IS NOT COMPETENT FOR THE SENATE TO ANNUL THAT ELECTION.
TO ADOPT THE RESOLUTION TO DISMISS BLAIR AND RIVES AS PRINTERS OF THE SENATE FOR THE 27TH CONGRESS.
TO POSTPONE, UNTIL THE 2ND MONDAY IN DECEMBER, CONSIDERATION OF THE RESOLUTION TO ELECT A SERGEANT-AT-ARMS AND DOOR- KEEPER TO THE SENATE.
TO ADOPT THE RESOLUTION THAT THE SENATE WILL, ON MONDAY MARCH 8, 1841, AT 1 P.M., PROCEED TO ELECT A SERGEANT-AT- ARMS AND DOOR-KEEPER.

TO INSTRUCT THE SECRETARY OF STATE, TO RETURN THE OFFICIAL BOND TO BLAIR AND RIVES, IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE RESOLUTION AS ADOPTED TO DISMISS BLAIR AND RIVES AS PRINTERS OF THE SENATE FOR THE 27TH CONGRESS.
TO REMOVE THE INJUNCTION OF SECRECY FROM THE PROCEEDINGS OF THE SENATE AND DEBATE ON THE NOMINATION OF FRANCIS GRANGER TO BE POSTMASTER GENERAL.
TO PRINT LETTERS OF THE ADJUTANT GENERAL AND OF THE SECRE- TARY OF STATE, IN CONNECTION WITH THE MEMORIAL OF GENERAL JESUP.

TO AMEND THE RESOLUTION TO WAIT ON THE PRESIDENT AND INFORM HIM THAT A QUORUM OF BOTH HOUSES IS ASSEMBLED AND READY TO RECEIVE ANY COMMUNICATIONS HE MAY BE PLEASED TO MAKE, BY SUBSTITUTING THE WORD VICE-PRESIDENT IN PLACE OF PRESIDENT, DUE TO THE DEATH OF THE LATE PRESIDENT.
TO AMEND THE RESOLUTION TO REPEAL AN ACT TO PROVIDE FOR THE COLLECTION, SAFE KEEPING, TRANSFER AND DISBURSEMENT OF THE PUBLIC REVENUE, BY PROVIDING THAT A SUBSTITUTE BILL BE REPORTED.

TO AMEND AN AMENDMENT TO THE BILL S. 1 (APP. 8/13/1841) (0), TO REPEAL THE ACT ENTITLED, "AN ACT TO PROVIDE FOR THE COLLECTION, SAFEKEEPING, TRANSFER AND DISBURSEMENTS OF THE PUBLIC REVENUE" AND TO PROVIDE FOR THE PUNISHMENT OF EMBEZ- ZLERS OF THE PUBLIC MONIES, WHICH AMENDMENT REPEALS THAT PART OF SECTION 5 OF THE ACT OF JUNE 23, 1836, WHICH PRO- VIDES THAT NO BANK SHALL ISSUE OR PAY OUT ANY NOTE OR BILL IN AN AMOUNT LESS THAN $5.
TO AGREE TO THE AMENDED AMENDMENT TO S. 1, WHICH REPEALS THE ACT OF JUNE 23, 1836, WITH THE EXCEPTION OF THE 13TH AND 14TH SECTIONS, AND A SUPPLEMENTARY ACT APPROVED JULY 4, 1836.
TO AMEND S. 1, SO AS TO EXCEPT FROM REPEAL THOSE SECTIONS RELATING TO THE PAYMENT IN SPECIE OF TAXES, DUTIES, DEBTS AND OTHER OBLIGATIONS DUE TO THE UNITED STATES.
TO AMEND S. 1, SO AS TO EXCEPT FROM REPEAL SECTION 21, WHICH PROVIDES THAT ALL DISBURSEMENTS AND DRAFTS DRAWN ON THE GOVERNMENT SHALL BE IN GOLD OR SILVER.
TO AMEND S. 1, SO AS TO EXCEPT FROM REPEAL SECTION 25 WHICH PROVIDES THAT THE TREASURER OF THE UNITED STATES MAY RECEIVE PAYMENT IN ADVANCE FOR PUBLIC LANDS.

TO AMEND S. 1, SO AS TO EXCEPT FROM REPEAL SECTION 25 WHICH PROVIDES THAT THE MINT OF THE UNITED STATES LOCATED AT PHILADELPHIA AND THE BRANCH MINT AT NEW ORLEANS SHALL BE MADE DEPOSITORIES FOR THE PUBLIC MONIES.
TO AGREE TO THE AMENDMENT TO S. 1, WHICH PROPOSES TO EXCEPT FROM REPEAL SECTION 2 WHICH WOULD MAKE THE MINT AT PHILADELPHIA AND THE MINT AT NEW ORLEANS DEPOSITORIES FOR PUBLIC MONEY.
TO AMEND S. 1, TO PROVIDE THAT THE BANK OF THE UNITED STATES AND ITS BRANCHES DISCONTINUE THE COLLECTION AND SAFE KEEPING OF THE PUBLIC MONIES.
TO ORDER ENGROSSMENT AND THIRD READING OF S. 1.
TO POSTPONE UNTIL TOMORROW CONSIDERATION OF THAT PORTION OF THE PRESIDENT'S MESSAGE DEALING WITH FOREIGN RELATIONS.
TO RECOMMIT S. 1  TO THE COMMITTEE ON FINANCE WITH INSTRUC- TIONS TO REPORT A SUBSTITUTE FOR THE BILL.

TO RECOMMIT S. 1  TO THE COMMITTEE ON FINANCE WITH INSTRUC- TIONS TO AMEND THE BILL TO PROVIDE THAT GUARDS BE FURNISHED TO GUARD THE PUBLIC MONIES RECEIVED FROM THE TIME OF PASSAGE OF THIS ACT UNTIL THEY ARE INFORMED OF SAME, AND TO GIVE THE TREASURY DEPARTMENT AMPLE TIME TO SECURE OTHER BONDS FROM DEPOSITORIES AND RECEIVERS OF PUBLIC REVENUE AS A RESULT OF THE REPEAL OF THIS ACT.
TO ADJOURN; MOTION MADE DURING CONSIDERATION OF S. 1.
TO ADJOURN; MOTION MADE DURING DEBATE ON S. 1.
TO PASS S. 1.
TO TABLE THE RESOLUTION RELATIVE TO THE REMOVAL OF GENERAL MATHEW ARBUCKLE FROM HIS COMMAND AT FORT GIBSON.

TO TABLE THE RESOLUTION THAT WHEN THE SENATE ADJOURNS DURING THE PRESENT SESSION, LEAVING A SUBJECT UNDER DISCUSSION AND UNDECIDED, THE CONSIDERATION OF THE SUBJECT SHALL BE RESUMED AT THE NEXT MEETING OF THE SENATE, IMMEDIATELY AFTER THE JOURNAL IS READ AND PETITIONS AND REPORTS ARE RECEIVED, WITHOUT WAITING FOR THE USUAL HOUR OF 1 P.M..

TO TABLE THE RESOLUTION REQUESTING INFORMATION OF THE SECRE- TARY OF WAR RELATIVE TO FRAUDS COMMITTED BY CONTRACTORS IN THE SOUTHWEST, ALLEGED IN HIS COMMUNICATION TO THE PRESIDENT ON MAY 1, 1841, REGARDING ENORMOUS PROFITS MADE UNDER INDIAN ANNUITIES, AND TO FURNISH THE SENATE WITH THE NAMES OF ALL THESE CONTRACTORS.
TO TABLE A MEMORIAL TO SANCTION AN ACT OF THE LEGISLATURE OF MARYLAND FOR THE COMPLETION OF THE CHESAPEAKE AND OHIO CANAL TO CUMBERLAND.
TO TABLE THE MOTION TO PRINT THE PROCEEDINGS OF THE CITIZENS OF CINCINNATI REMONSTRATING AGAINST THE ESTABLISHMENT OF A NATIONAL BANK.
TO POSTPONE UNTIL THE FIRST MONDAY IN DECEMBER NEXT, CONSI- DERATION OF THE BILL S. 4 (APP. 8/25/1841) (0), REVIEWING AND EXTENDING THE CHARTERS OF THE DISTRICT BANKS.
TO AMEND S. 4, BY PROHIBITING DISTRICT BANKS FROM ISSUING OR PAYING OUT ANY BILL OR NOTE FOR LESS THAN $20.
TO AMEND S. 4, SO AS TO PROVIDE THAT THE STOCKHOLDERS AND OFFICERS OF THESE BANKS BE INDIVIDUALLY LIABLE FOR PENALTIES AS A RESULT OF VIOLATIONS OF THE ACT.
TO AMEND S. 4, SO AS TO GRANT DISTRICT BANKS THE PRIVILEGE OF ISSUING ONE AND TWO DOLLAR NOTES FOR A PERIOD OF TWO YEARS.
TO RECOMMIT S. 4 TO COMMITTEE.
TO POSTPONE, UNTIL TOMORROW, CONSIDERATION OF THE BILL S. 5, TO INCORPORATE THE SUBSCRIBERS TO THE FISCAL BANK OF THE UNITED STATES.

TO RECOMMIT TO THE SELECT COMMITTEE THE BILL H. R. 1 (APP. 6/30/1841), TO GRANT THE SUM OF $25,000 TO MRS. HARRISON, WIDOW OF GENERAL WILLIAM HENRY HARRISON, WHO DIED IN OFFICE AS PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES, WITH INSTRUCTIONS TO MAKE A REPORT STATING GROUNDS AND REASONS FOR THE BILL.
TO PASS THE BILL H. R. 1 (APP. 6/30/1841) (0), TO GRANT THE SUME OF $25,000 TO MRS. HARRISON, WIDOW OF GENERAL WILLIAM HENRY HARRISON, WHO DIED IN OFFICE AS PRESIDENT OF THE U. S.
TO AMEND SECTION 18 OF S. 5, WHICH SECTION FORBIDS THE ISSUANCE OF ANY NOTE OF LESS THAN FIVE DOLLARS.
TO AMEND S. 5, SO AS TO PROVIDE THAT STOCK MAY BE TRANSFER- ABLE ON PAYMENT OF THE SECOND INSTALLMENT INSTEAD OF THE THIRD.
TO AMEND S. 5, SO AS TO PERMIT BANKS TO INCREASE THEIR DEBT LIMIT FROM 25 TO 30 MILLION DOLLARS.

TO AMEND S. 5, SO AS TO DIRECT THAT THE PAYMENT OF THE FOURTH INSTALLMENT OF THE FIFTH PARY TO CAPITAL SUBSCRIBED BY THE GOVERNMENT FOR THE ESTABLISHMENT OF BRANCHES, BE MADE BY THE SECRETARY OF THE TREASURY RATHER THAN BY CONGRESS.
TO AMEND S. 5, SO AS TO AUTHORIZE THE PRESIDENTS AND CASH- IERS OF BRANCHES TO SIGN NOTES, NOT EXCEEDING $20, WHICH ARE MADE PAYABLE AT THEIR SEVERAL OFFICES.
TO AMEND AN AMENDMENT TO S. 5, SO AS TO GIVE RESIDENT ALIENS THE PRIVILEGE OF PURCHASING STOCK IN THE FISCAL BANK OF THE UNITED STATES.

TO AMEND S. 5, SO AS TO OBLIGE ALL CORPORATIONS OR COMPANIES TO BELONG TO THE SEVERAL STATES OR TERRITORIES AND TO EXCLUDE FROM THE PURCHASE OF STOCK ALL PERSONS OTHER THAN UNITED STATES CITIZENS AND RISIDENT ALIENS.
TO AMEND S. 5, SO AS TO PROVIDE THAT ANY STOCKHOLDER MAY EXAMINE AND INSPECT ALL PRIVATE AND INDIVIDUAL ACCOUNTS, DEALINGS AND ACCOMMODATIONS AT ANY OF THE OFFICES OF DIS- COUNT AND DEPOSIT.
TO CONSENT TO THE NOMINATION OF ELISHA M. HUNTINGTON TO BE COMMISSIONER OF THE GENERAL LAND OFFICE OF THE UNITED STATES.
TO CHANGE THE DAILY MEETING HOUR OF THE SENATE FROM 10 TO 11 A.M., BEGINNING JULY 6, 1841.

TO AMEND AN AMENDMENT TO S. 5, SO AS TO ESTABLISH AGENCIES TO EMPLOY SUCH BANKS TO ACT AS FISCAL AGENTS OF THE GOVERN- MENT, AND TO CONVERT SUCH AGENCIES INTO OFFICES OF DISCOUNT AND DEPOSIT, PROVIDING THAT THEY ARE NOT CONTRARY TO STATE LAWS.
TO AMEND S. 5, SO AS TO CHANGE SLIGHTLY THE CONDITIONS OF ESTABLISHMENT OF COMPETENT OFFICES OF DISCOUNT AND DEPOSIT IN A STATE.
TO AMEND S. 5, SO AS TO PROVIDE THAT THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA SHALL NOT BE DESIGNATED AS A LOCALITY FOR THE FISCAL BANK.
TO AMEND S. 5, SO AS TO DESIGNATE NEW ORLEANS AS THE LOCAL- ITY OF THE FISCAL BANK.

TO TABLE THE FOLLOWING RESOLUTIONS: THAT ON THE NOMINATION OF JOHN MC CLINTOCK TO BE NAVAL OFFICER AT PORTSMOUTH, RE- PLACING GEORGE DENNET WHO WAS REMOVED, SUCH REMOVAL DEPEN- DENT ON THE CONSENT OF THE SENATE, THE SENATE BE GIVEN REA- SONS FOR HIS REMOVAL; AND THAT THE PRESIDENT BE REQUESTED, UNLESS CONSTITUTIONAL OBJECTIONS EXIST, TO GIVE TO THE SENATE EVIDENCE THAT REMOVAL OF DENNET WAS NOT ON ACCOUNT OF DIFFERENCE IN POLITICAL OPINION.
TO AMEND S. 5, SO AS TO PROVIDE THAT THE CASHIERS OF EVERY OFFICE OF DISCOUNT OR DEPOSIT SHALL, EACH YEAR, SEND TO EACH HOUSE OF CONGRESS, A COMPLETE RECORD OF ALL TRANSACTIONS.
TO AMEND S. 5, SO AS TO PROVIDE THAT ANY TEN OR MORE STOCK- HOLDERS MAY HAVE THE RIGHT TO EXAMINE THE ACCOUNTS OF PRI- VATE INDIVIDUALS.
TO AMEND S. 5, SO AS TO REQUIRE BANKS TO KEEP THEIR BOOKS OPEN TO THE PUBLIC SHOWING ALL TRANSACTIONS CONCERNING BILLS AND NOTES.
TO AMEND S. 5, SO AS TO PROVIDE THAT NO TRANSACTION IS TO BE KEPT SECRET FROM GOVERNMENT DIRECTORS, AND THEY SHALL BE FREE TO PARTICIPATE IN ALL TRANSACTIONS OF THE INSTITUTIONS.
TO AMEND S. 5, SO AS TO PROVIDE THAT NO BANK IS TO PAY OUT BULLION.
TO AMEND S. 5, SO AS TO PROVIDE THAT ANY CONTRACT FOR RENEW- WAL OR EXTENSION ON ANY LOAN BEYOND 180 DAYS, SHALL BE NULL AND VOID.

TO AMEND S. 5, SO AS TO PROVIDE THAT ORDERS BE PUBLISHED IN SOME NEWSPAPER, AT THE SEAT OF GOVERNMENT, FROM BANK DIREC- TORS TO MEMBER BANKS.  SUCH ORDERS ARE ALSO TO BE REPORTED BACK TO CONGRESS AND THE SECRETARY OF THE TREASURY.
TO AMEND S. 5, BY RESTRICTING TO $10,000 THE AMOUNT THAT MAY BE LOANED TO ANY BANK OFFICER OR DIRECTOR.
TO AMEND S. 5, BY PROHIBITING THE BANK FROM MAKING ANY LOANS TO MEMBERS OF CONGRESS.

TO AMEND AN AMENDMENT TO S. 5, THE ORIGINAL AMENDMENT OF MR. WOODBURY PROHIBITING DIRECTORS OR STOCKHOLDERS FROM MAKING ANY DONATIONS, AND THE AMENDMENT IN THE SECOND DEGREE PROHI- BITING DONATIONS BEING MADE TO OFFICERS AND STOCKHOLDERS OF THE BANK.
TO AMEND AN AMENDMENT TO S. 5 WHICH AMENDMENT PERMITS STOCK- HOLDERS TO MAKE DONATIONS OUT OF THE FUNDS OF THE BANK; THE AMENDMENT THERETO PROHIBITS DONATIONS BEING MADE TO OFFICERS OF THE BANK.
TO AMEND AN AMENDMENT TO S. 5, SO AS TO PROVIDE THAT ANY DONATION MADE BY THE BANK OR ITS BRANCHES IS NOT TO BE CHARGED AGAINST THE FUNDS OF THE GOVERNMENT.
TO AMEND S. 5, SO AS TO ELIMINATE THE PROVISION THAT AFTER 1851 THE BANK MAY INCREASE ITS CAPITAL FROM 30 TO 50 MILLION DOLLARS.
TO AMEND S. 5, SO AS TO ELIMINATE THE CLAUSE WHEREBY THE GOVERNMENT SUBSCRIBES FOR ONE HUNDRED THOUSAND SHARES OF STOCK OF THE BANK.

TO AMEND S. 5, SO AS TO PROVIDE THAT THE SECRETARY OF THE TREASURY SHALL SUBSCRIBE TO ALL STOCK THAT REMAINS UNSUB- SCRIBED FOR BY DECEMBER 20, 1841, AND SHALL BE EMPOWERED TO SELL SAME LATER AT A SUM NOT LESS THAN COST.

TO AMEND S. 5, SO AS TO ELIMINATE THAT PORTION WHICH ALLOWS THE BANK TO START OPERATING AFTER SIX MILLION DOLLARS HAD BEEN SUBSCRIBED, AND TO INSERT THE PROVISION THAT THE BANK SHALL NOT OPERATE UNTIL THE TOTAL AMOUNT, AS REQUIRED BY LAW HAS BEEN PAID.

TO AMEND S. 5, SO AS TO MAKE IT THE DUTY OF THE ATTORNEY GENERAL TO RESTRAIN THE FURTHER OPERATION BY ANY FISCAL BANK OF THE UNITED STATES UNABLE TO MAKE SPECIE PAYMENTS, AND TO HAVE A TRUSTEE NAMED IN RECEIVERSHIP; TO ALSO PROVIDE THAT THE BANK'S ASSETS TO PAID TO CREDITORS, THE BALANCE TO GO INTO THE UNITED STATES TREASURY.

TO AMEND AN AMENDMENT TO S. 5, PROVIDING THAT "IF THE SAID BANK OR ANY OF ITS BRANCHES SHALL AT ANYTIME SUSPEND SPECIE PAYMENTS, OR NEGLECT OR REFUSE TO DISCHARGE ON DEMAND ANY AND ALL OF ITS LIABILITIES IN SPECIE, THEN ITS BILLS OR NOTES SHALL NO LONGER BE RECEIVED IN PAYMENT OF ANY DEBT OR DEMAND DUE THE U. S.", BY PROVIDING INSTEAD THAT NO NOTES SHOULD BE RECEIVED DURING THE TIME OF SUSPENSION.

TO AMEND AN AMENDMENT WHICH PROVIDES THAT IF THE SAID BANK OR ANY OF ITS BRANCHES SHALL SUSPEND SPECIE PAYMENTS, OR NEGLECT OR REFUSE TO DISCHARGE ON DEMAND ANY AND ALL OF ITS LIABILITIES  IN SPECIES, THEN ITS BILLS OR NOTES SHALL NO LONGER BE RECEIVED IN PAYMENT OF ANY DEBT OR DEMAND DUE THE U. S., BY PROVIDING THAT SUSPENSION OF SPECIE PAYMENTS SHOULD BE CONSIDERED A CAUSE OF FORFEITURE OF THE CHARTER.
TO ADOPT AND AMENDED AMENDMENT TO S. 5, TO PROVIDE THAT SUS- PENSION OF SPECIE PAYMENTS SHALL BE CAUSE FOR FORFIETURE OF THE BANK'S CHARTER.
TO AMEND S. 5, SO AS TO DOUBLE THE PERCENTAGE OF RESPONSI- BILITY OF THE BANK DURING A STATE OF SUSPENSION.
TO AMEND S. 5, BY ELIMINATING THAT PORTION WHICH PROVIDES THAT NO OTHER BANK SHALL BE ESTABLISHED DURING CONTINUANCE OF THE PRESENT BANK.
TO AMEND S. 5, TO PROVIDE THAT THE REFUSAL ON THE BANK'S PART TO ALLOW A COMMITTEE FOR CONGRESS TO INSPECT THE BOOKS, SHALL BE CAUSE FOR FORFEITURE OF THE BANK'S CHARTER.
TO AMEND S. 5, BY REDUCING THE RATE OF INTEREST ON LOANS ISSUED BY THE BANK, FROM 6% TO 5%.
TO CONSENT TO THE NOMINATION OF JOSEPH EACHES TO BE COLLEC- TOR OF CUSTOMS FOR THE DISTRICT OF ALEXANDRIA, IN THE DIS- TRICT OF COLUMBIA.
TO TABLE THE NOMINATION OF JOSEPH RITTNER, TO BE TREASURER OF THE MINT OF THE UNTIED STATES AT PHILADELPHIA.
TO CONSENT TO THE NOMINATION OF JOHN CHAMBERS TO BE GOVERNOR OF THE TERRITORY OF IOWA.

TO AMEND AN AMENDMENT TO THE BILL H. R. 5 (APP. 7/21/1841) (0), TO AUTHORIZE A LOAN OF 12 MILLION DOLLARS FOR THE RE- QUIREMENTS OF THE GOVERNMENT, BY ELIMINATING THE CLAUSE IN THE AMENDMENT WHICH PROHIBITS THE REDEMPTION OF TREASURY NOTES NOT DUE.

TO AMEND H. R. 5, TO PROVIDE THAT THE LOAN SHALL BE NO GREATER THAN THE PRESIDENT SHALL DEEM NECESSARY; AND ALSO TO REDEEM TREASURY NOTES AS THEY BECOME DUE OUT OF MONIES COL- LECTED FROM CUSTOMS, LANDS AND OTHER SOURCES.
TO AMEND H. R. 5, TO PROVIDE THAT THE LOAN SHOULD BE APPLIED TO DEBTS ALREADY CONTRACTED, AND FOR THE DEFENSE OF THE COUNTRY ONLY.
TO AMEND H. R. 5, TO REDUCE THE AMOUNT OF THE LOAN FROM 12 TO 6 MILLION DOLLARS.
TO AMEND H. R. 5, TO REDUCE THE LOAN FROM 12 MILLION TO 9 MILLION DOLLARS.
TO AMEND H. R. 5, TO PROVIDE THAT TWO MILLION DOLLARS OF THE LOAN BE SET ASIDE AS A RESERVE FUND TO MEET CONTINGENCIES WHEN CONGRESS IS NOT IN SESSION.

TO AMEND H. R. 5, TO ELIMINATE SECTION 1 OF THE BILL WHICH PROVIDES THAT THE SECRETARY OF THE TREASURY MAY DISBURSE SUCH MONIES AS IN HIS OPINION THE GOVERNMENT MAY REQUIRE, AND INSERT THAT MONIES MAY ONLY BE DISBURSED AS ARE APPRO- PRIATED BY CONGRESS.
TO AMEND H. R. 5, TO MAKE IT UNLAWFUL FOR THE SECRETARY OF THE TREASURY TO RE-ISSUE ANY TREASURY NOTES THAT MAY HERE- AFTER BE REDEEMED.
TO ADJOURN, DUE TO THE LATENESS OF THE HOUR; MOTION MADE DURING CONSIDERATION OF H. R. 5.
TO AMEND H. R. 5, SO AS TO LIMIT THE POWER OF THE SECRETARY TO REISSUE TREASURY NOTES.
TO PASS H. R. 5.
TO AMEND S. 5, TO PROVIDE THAT NOTHING IN THIS ACT SHALL IMPAIR THE RIGHT OF ANY STATE TO TAX THE BANK OR ITS BRANCHES.
TO AMEND S. 5, TO PROVIDE THAT THE BUSINESS OF THE BANK SHOULD BE CONFINED TO THE BUYING AND SELLING OF BILLS OF EXCHANGE, WITH A PERIOD NOT EXCEEDING 180 DAYS.
TO AMEND S. 5, TO MAKE STOCKHOLDERS LIABLE FOR THE OBLIG- ATIONS OF THE INSTITUTION.
TO AMEND S. 5 BY PROHIBITING CORPORATIONS FROM HOLDING STOCK IN THIS BANK.
TO AMEND S. 5, TO PROVIDE THAT NO LOAN IS TO BE MADE BY THIS BANK OR ANY OF ITS BRANCHES TO ANY CORPORATION.
TO AMEND S. 5, SO AS TO TAKE AWAY THE POWER OF THE SECRETARY OF THE TREASURY TO SELL STOCK SUBSCRIBED FOR BY THE UNITED STATES, AND TO GIVE THAT POWER TO CONGRESS.
TO AMEND S. 5, SO AS TO PROVIDE FOR A SEMI-ANNUAL DIVIDEND AFTER CERTAIN EXPENSES ARE DEDUCTED.
TO AMEND S. 5, SO AS TO LIMIT THE POWER OF THE BANKS TO DIS- COUNT ANY NOTES IN CIRCULATION.
TO AMEND S. 5, SO AS TO ESTABLISH THE CONDITIONS FOR DISTRI- BUTION AMONG THE BRANCHES OF THE CAPITAL STOCK OF THE BANK.
TO AMEND S. 5, SO AS TO PROHIBIT PRIVATE USE BY ANY OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS OF THE BANK, OF THE MONIES WITHIN THE BANK.
TO AMEND S. 5, SO AS TO ELIMINATE THE CLAUSE FIXING THE VALUE OF GOLD COINS TO BE RECEIVED BY THE BANK.
TO AMEND S. 5, SO AS TO BAN THE DEALING IN COIN.
TO AMEND S. 5, TO SPECIFY WHEN THE BANK IS PERMITTED TO COM- MENCE OPERATING.
TO CONSENT TO THE NOMINATION OF ANDERSON MILLER TO BE UNITED STATES MARSHALL FOR THE SOUTHERN DISTRICT OF MISSISSIPPI.
TO ORDER ENGROSSMENT AND THIRD READING OF THE BILL S. 6, TO CHANGE THE VENUE IN THE CASES OF THE UNITED STATES VS. CHARLES GRATIOT, FROM MISSOURI TO THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA.
TO PROCEED TO THE CONSIDERATION OF THE BILL S. 3 (5 STAT. 440, APP. 8/19/1841), PROVIDING A UNIFORM LAW ON THE SUBJECT OF BANKRUPTCY IN THE UNITED STATES.

TO AMEND MR. NICHOLSON'S AMENDMENT TO S. 3, SO AS TO ELIMIN- ATE THE SECTION WHICH WOULD INCLUDE CORPORATIONS "EXCEPT THOSE IN WHICH THE STOCK IS OWNED WHOLLY, OR IN PART, BY A STATE, OR FOR WHICH A STATE IS RESPONSIBLE."
TO AMEND S. 3, SO AS TO INCLUDE BANKING CORPORATIONS IN THE ACT, EXCEPT THOSE WHOSE STOCK IS OWNED, IN WHOLE OR IN PART, BY THE STATE, OR FOR WHICH THE STATE IS RESPONSIBLE.

TO AMEND S. 3, TO ELIMINATE THE PROVISION THAT THIS ACT IS NOT TO ANNUL THE RIGHTS OF MARRIED WOMEN, MINORS, LIENS, MORTGAGES OR OTHER SECURITIES ON PROPERTY, WHICH ARE VALID BY STATE LAWS AND WHICH ARE NOT INCONSISTENT WITH THE SECOND AND FIFTH SECTIONS OF THIS ACT.
TO ORDER ENGROSSMENT AND THIRD READING OF S. 3.
TO PASS S. 3.
TO AMEND S. 5, TO PROVIDE THAT NO PERSON IS TO TRANSFER OR ASSIGN HIS STOCK TO ANY NON-CITIZEN OF THE UNITED STATES.

TO AMEND AN AMENDMENT TO S. 5, OUTLINING THE CONDITIONS UN- DER WHICH STOCKHOLDERS MAY INSPECT INDIVIDUAL OR PRIVATE ACCOUNTS IN SAID BANK OR ANY OF ITS BRANCHES, BY PROVIDING THAT SAID STOCKHOLDERS SHALL HAVE HELD AT LEAST 500 SHARES FOR AT LEAST 3 MONTHS BEFORE THEY MAY INSPECT SAID ACCOUNTS.
TO ADOPT AN AMENDED AMENDMENT TO S. 5, WHICH OUTLINES THE CONDITIONS UNDER WHICH STOCKHOLDERS MAY INSPECT INDIVIDUAL OR PRIVATE ACCOUNTS IN SAID BANK OR ANY OF ITS BRANCHES.
TO CONCUR IN THE AMENDMENT TO S. 5, WHICH ELIMINATES THE RESTRICTION ON THE AMOUNT THAT A DIRECTOR OF THE BANK MAY BORROW.
TO ADOPT A MODIFIED AMENDMENT TO S. 5, THAT PROVIDES THAT NO NOTE OR BILL SHALL BE DISCOUNTED FOR ANY MEMBER OF EITHER HOUSE OF CONGRESS.
TO CONCUR IN THE AMENDMENT TO S. 5, WHICH PROVIDES A LIMIT TO THE SUM THAT ANY OFFICER MAY BE INDEBTED TO THE CORPOR- ATION.
TO AMEND S. 5, TO PROVIDE THAT TEN DOLLARS IS THE LOWEST DENOMINATION NOTE THAT CAN BE ISSUED.
TO AMEND S. 5, TO WITHDRAW THE POWER OF THE PRESIDENT TO APPOINT DIRECTORS TO SAID BANKS, INSTEAD OF ALLOWING CONGRESS TO ELECT THE SAME; WITH PROVISIONS FOR SAID ELECTIONS.
TO AMEND S. 5, TO EXCLUDE CERTAIN PEOPLE FROM BEING ELIGI- BLE TO BECOME A DIRECTOR OR AGENT OF THIS BANK.
TO AMEND S. 5, TO EXCLUDE CERTAIN PEOPLE FROM ELIGIBILITY TO HOLD OFFICE IN THIS BANK; AND TO PROVIDE FOR OFFICERS TO SUBSCRIBE ON OATH THAT THEY ARE NOT VIOLATING THE PROVISIONS OF THIS ACT.
TO AMEND S. 5, BY PROVIDING THAT ALL THE LAWS THAT GOVERN THE PUBLIC MONIES IN THE TREASURY OF THE U.S., SHALL BE APPLICABLE TO MONIES DEPOSITED IN THIS BANK OR ITS BRANCHES.
TO AMEND S. 5, TO PROVIDE THAT NO LOAN SHALL BE MADE TO ANY- ONE IN A LARGER AMOUNT THAN $10,000, SO LONG AS THERE ARE VALID APPLICATIONS AND GOOD SECURITY FOR LOANS OF A LESSER AMOUNT.
TO AMEND S. 5, TO PROVIDE THAT NO CONGRESSMAN, DURING HIS TERM OR FOR TWO YEARS AFTER, SHALL BE EMPLOYED BY THIS BANK OR ITS BRANCHES IN ANY WAY.
TO AMEND S. 5, TO PROVIDE THAT CONGRESS RESERVES THE POWER TO ALTER OR REPEAL THIS ACT, EXCEPT WHERE IT PROVIDES FOR THE PAYMENT OF A LOAN ALREADY CONTRACTED.
TO AMEND S. 5, TO PROHIBIT LOANS BEING GRANTED TO HEADS OF DEPARTMENTS OF THE GOVERNMENT AND JUDGES OF THE SUPREME COURT.
TO ADJOURN, MOTION MADE DURING DEBATE ON S. 5.

UPON RECONSIDERATION, TO AMEND S. 5, TO PERMIT THE BANK TO ISSUE NOTES OF A DENOMINATION OF $5.00.
TO ORDER ENGROSSMENT AND THIRD READING OF S. 5.

TO AMEND S. 5, TO PROVIDE THAT BRANCHES MAY BE ESTABLISHED ANYWHERE IN THE UNITED STATES WITH STATE APPROVAL.  AMEND- MENT CONTAINS CONDITIONS FOR SUCH APPROVAL AND CONDITIONS FOR REMOVAL OF SUCH BRANCH.
TO POSTPONE INDEFINITELY CONSIDERATION OF S. 5, IN ORDER TO AWAIT A CONGRESS ELECTED UNDER THE NEW CENSUS.
TO PASS S. 5.

TO AMEND H. R. 6, TO PROVIDE THAT NO OFFICER, SEAMAN OR MARINE ENTITLED TO A PENSION FROM THE NAVY, SHALL RECEIVE BOTH THE PENSION AND PAY FROM THE PUBLIC TREASURY AS AN OFFICER IN SERVICE.

TO AMEND S. 4, TO PERMIT THESE BANKS TO PAY OUT AND CIRCU- LATE THE NOTES OF SUSPENDED BANKS UNTIL MARCH, 1842.  S. 4 (APP. 8/25/1841), IS A BILL TO REVIVE AND EXTEND THE CHAR- TERS OF THE DISTRICT BANKS.

TO ORDER ENGROSSMENT AND THIRD READING OF S. 4.
TO ORDER ENGROSSMENT AND THIRD READING OF THE BILL H. R. 7 (APP. 8/3/1841) (0), TO APPROPRIATE FUNDS FOR THE SUPPORT OF PAUPER LUNATICS OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA.

R. 8 (APP. 9/9/1841) (0), APPROPRIATING FUNDS FOR THE DEFENSE OF THE COUNTRY AND THE SUPPRESSION OF INDIAN HOSTILITIES, TO COM- MITTEE, WITH INSTRUCTIONS TO INCLUDE THE NECESSARY APPROPRI- ATIONS FOR POSTS, FORTIFICATIONS, HARBORS, RIVERS AND MILITARY ROADS ON THE SOUTHWESTERN AND NORTHWESTERN FRON- TIERS WHICH MAY BE DEEMED NECESSARY FOR THE DEFENSE OF THE COUNTRY; SO THAT THE INSTRUCTIONS PROVIDE FOR AN AMENDMENT INCLUDING APPROPRIATIONS FOR FORTIFICATIONS, ETC., TO DEFEND THE WESTERN, NORTHWESTERN, AND SOUTHWESTERN FRONTIERS.

TO RECOMMIT H.R. 8 TO COMMITTEE WITH INSTRUCTIONS TO ADD THE NECESSARY APPROPRIATIONS FOR SUCH FORTS FOR THE SOUTH, SOUTHWESTERN, AND NORTHWESTERN FRONTIERS AS MAY BE PROPER FOR THE DEFENSE OF THE COUNTRY.
